questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a volatile memory type, meaning its contents are lost when power is removed?
options: Solid State Drive (SSD)
Hard Disk Drive (HDD)
Read-Only Memory (ROM)
Dynamic Random-Access Memory (DRAM)
Flash Memory

questions.question: In the digital IC design flow, what is the primary goal of achieving 'timing closure'?
options: Ensuring all functional blocks operate within their power budget
Verifying the logical correctness of the RTL design against specifications
Guaranteeing that all clock signals arrive simultaneously at all flip-flops
Satisfying all setup and hold time constraints across all operating conditions (PVT corners)
Minimizing the physical area occupied by the integrated circuit

questions.question: In a MOSFET, what does the 'threshold voltage' (Vt) primarily represent?
options: The maximum voltage the gate oxide can withstand before breakdown
The voltage at which the transistor starts conducting significantly by forming an inversion layer
The voltage required to turn the transistor completely off
The voltage difference between the source and drain terminals at saturation
The voltage at which the gate current becomes negligible

questions.question: In a system with multiple devices sharing a common bus (e.g., a memory bus), what is the primary role of a 'bus arbiter'?
options: To translate addresses from virtual to physical memory
To enforce cache coherence among multiple processors
To ensure fair and efficient allocation of bus access among competing masters
To regulate the clock frequency of the bus
To store frequently accessed data for faster retrieval

questions.question: In the context of digital IC verification, what does 'functional coverage' primarily measure?
options: The percentage of the design's physical area that has been routed
The extent to which the testbench stimulates and observes all specified behaviors of the design
The number of clock cycles required to execute a specific test case
The amount of power consumed by the design under various operational scenarios
The ratio of test vectors to the total gates in the design
